instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.PPV3V42_G3H: What is PPV3V42_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V42_G3H When you see PPV3V42_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message:
I'm kind of stuck with this old <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. When plugged in the light on the charger is blinking.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> i fluctuating between 3.5V and 11.5V, at least this is what i can read on my multimeter. I guess something makes the charger start and stop.
It does not run on either battery or charger.

Current sensing resistors measures fine.
If I remove F7000 or <RESISTOR>R7008</RESISTOR> the blinking slows down.
If I remove both F7000 and <RESISTOR>R7008</RESISTOR> I get solid green light and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.5V.

There is no short to ground om <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

I have measured resistance to ground on both <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and they are both very high.

I have replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
I have replaced both <TRANSISTOR>Q7020</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7021</TRANSISTOR>.
I have replaced <CAPACITOR>C7008</CAPACITOR>.

I do need some pointers now, I feel I'm looking in the wrong place.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: You did replace with <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> and not 6259? Check DCIN, VDD and VDDP

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: Yes, <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>, DCIN fluctuates as well, so as long as I get the blinking, nothing else seems stable. VDD and VDDP fluctuates as well

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: When removing F7000 I get 11,7V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 5V on VDD and VDDP

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7000</TRANSISTOR>/7001 and <CHIP>U7060</CHIP> are next. You did inspect for water damage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: Hmm, replaced them all, but still the same :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: It was Wine damaged, but there was only slight corrosion around the audio chip as far as I could tell

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: What does it do on a battery that has a charge in it? Does in battery indicator show anything?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: Nothing, when a fully charged battery connected I get 11.96V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> but it won't start. Battery indicator shows nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: If the SMC is running and the BIL is good then it should show battery level. Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> and 3V42 and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message:
Checking <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R2072</RESISTOR> pin 2 i get 0v  checking <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR> pin 1 I get 3.42V

What is the BIL? also you said "check 3v42"  

Checked <SIGNAL>PPV3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> at <CAPACITOR>C5003</CAPACITOR> pin 1 3.4v <CAPACITOR>C5009</CAPACITOR> pin 1 3.42V
Checked <SIGNAL>SMC_BIL_BUTTON_L</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R5181</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.42V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blinking green light
threads.message: No idea why this year old thread is pulled from the dead. Start a new one.
